result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn E Londre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence. Not eligible for CIP, Eligible for SAP.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  All non mandatory court costs waived BTC.  DNA Surcharge and Victim witness mandatory charge assessed.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. No contact with establishments whos primary purpose is to serve and sell alcohol.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn E Londre

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn E Londre in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Shawn E Londre. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record, State is requesting defendant plea to all seven counts in the amended information, and the 22CM251 misd file be DRI, with a recommendation of 1 year in the county jail.. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct. 1: NC Ct. 2: NC Ct. 3: NC Ct.4: NC Ct.5: NC CT.6: NC Ct.7: NC 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. Defendant makes statement on his own behalf. 


BTC: Ct 1-7 Guilty on all 7 counts, Case 22CM251 DRI 
Court orders sentence as follows on each count. 
 2 years WSP I/S , 1 year IC  and 1 year ES on each count. Count 2 to run consecutive to Count 1, all remaining counts to run concurrent. CFTS, if revoked
2 years probation on each count
Conditions:
60 days conditional time stayed
Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts.  AODA & follow through.
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent & follow through with
recommendations.
Obtain HSED/GED
No contact with: Drug USERS/DEALER
No contact with establishments who primary purpose is to serve/ sell alcohol.
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
FAW/vote/jury service
CIP: NO
SAP: YES
Costs waived except for mandatory surcharges
to Consolidate
Stipulation for Consolidation

BTC; Matter set for pleas.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shawn E Londre appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Shawn E Londre. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
